research_context.focus: Agent Communication Protocol (ACP) and Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A)
research_context.research_objective: Develop protocol adaptation framework and evaluation methodology

quantitative_methodologies.description: Methodologies emphasizing numerical measurement, statistical analysis, and controlled experimentation
quantitative_methodologies.philosophical_foundation: Positivist paradigm, objective reality, hypothesis testing

methodologies.name: Design Science Research
methodologies.description: Methodology for designing and evaluating artifacts (protocols, frameworks, systems) to solve identified problems
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Very High - Specifically designed for creating and evaluating technical artifacts
methodologies.timeline_fit: Excellent - 12-16 weeks typical for protocol research
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Perfect - Matches protocol adaptation and evaluation objectives

methodologies.name: Experimental Research Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology based on controlled experiments to test hypotheses about protocol performance
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: High - Good for protocol performance evaluation

methodologies.name: Comparative Research Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology for systematic comparison of different approaches, protocols, or solutions
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: High - Ideal for comparing protocol approaches
methodologies.alignment_with_research: High - Directly supports protocol selection and evaluation

qualitative_methodologies.description: Methodologies emphasizing understanding, interpretation, and contextual analysis

methodologies.name: Case Study Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology for in-depth investigation of real-world contexts and applications
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Moderate - Good for understanding protocol application contexts
methodologies.timeline_fit: Moderate - 10-16 weeks depending on case complexity
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Moderate - Provides real-world validation but limited to specific contexts

methodologies.name: Grounded Theory Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology for building theory from systematic data collection and analysis
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Low - Better suited for social phenomena than technical protocols
methodologies.timeline_fit: Poor - Requires extensive data collection (16-24 weeks)
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Low - Not well-suited for technical protocol research

methodologies.name: Phenomenological Research Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology for understanding lived experiences and meanings
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Very Low - Not appropriate for technical protocol research
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Very Low - Does not match technical research objectives

mixed_methodologies.description: Methodologies combining quantitative and qualitative approaches for triangulation
mixed_methodologies.philosophical_foundation: Pragmatist paradigm, multiple perspectives, practical solutions

methodologies.name: Sequential Explanatory Mixed Methods
methodologies.description: Methodology using quantitative phase followed by qualitative phase for explanation
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: High - Quantitative evaluation followed by contextual understanding
methodologies.alignment_with_research: High - Comprehensive approach for protocol research

methodologies.name: Sequential Exploratory Mixed Methods
methodologies.description: Methodology using qualitative exploration followed by quantitative validation
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Moderate - Good for exploring new protocol domains
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Moderate - Useful when protocol requirements are unclear

methodologies.name: Convergent Parallel Mixed Methods
methodologies.description: Methodology collecting quantitative and qualitative data simultaneously for triangulation
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Moderate - Good for comprehensive protocol evaluation
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Moderate - Provides multiple perspectives on protocol performance

specialized_methodologies.description: Domain-specific methodologies for particular research contexts

methodologies.name: Action Research Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology involving stakeholders in identifying problems and developing solutions
methodologies.timeline_fit: Poor - Stakeholder coordination extends timeline (16-24 weeks)
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Low - Limited access to DER maintenance stakeholders

methodologies.name: Delphi Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology for achieving expert consensus through iterative rounds
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Moderate - Good for protocol requirements validation
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Moderate - Useful for validating protocol specifications

methodologies.name: Systematic Literature Review Methodology
methodologies.description: Methodology for systematically reviewing and synthesizing existing research
methodologies.suitability_for_protocols: Moderate - Good for understanding protocol landscape
methodologies.alignment_with_research: Moderate - Provides foundation but limited novel contribution

research_alignment.description: How well the methodology aligns with protocol research objectives

methodological_rigor.description: Scientific validity and reliability of the methodology

practical_applicability.description: Potential for practical application and impact

strongly_recommended.rationale: Perfect alignment with protocol adaptation research objectives. Established methodology for artifact creation and evaluation. Suitable timeframe for 20-week thesis. Clear deliverable structure (artifacts, evaluation, guidelines). Balances theoretical rigor with practical application.
strongly_recommended.supporting_evidence: Mentioned in Smart Grids Co-Simulations survey as systematic approach. Aligns with technical artifact development focus from research direction.

recommended.rationale: Comprehensive approach combining quantitative protocol evaluation with qualitative contextual understanding. Strong validation through method triangulation. Suitable for complex protocol research questions.
recommended.supporting_evidence: Mixed methods approaches mentioned in systematic reviews as providing comprehensive evaluation.

recommended.rationale: Ideal for systematic comparison of protocol approaches. High feasibility with available documentation. Direct support for protocol selection and adaptation decisions.
recommended.supporting_evidence: Comparative approaches extensively used in protocol research literature.

conditionally_recommended.rationale: Valuable for understanding real-world protocol application contexts. Provides practical validation. However, limited to specific contexts and dependent on access to suitable cases.

not_recommended.rationale: Not well-suited for technical protocol research. Requires extensive qualitative data collection. Better suited for social phenomena than technical artifacts.
Not appropriate for technical protocol research. Focuses on lived experiences rather than technical performance. Does not match research objectives.

design_science_core.rationale: DSR provides overarching framework while supporting approaches enable specific evaluation activities

mixed_methods_comprehensive.rationale: Comprehensive evaluation combining technical performance with practical applicability

comparative_foundation.rationale: Build understanding through systematic comparison before deeper evaluation

next_steps: Document each methodology category in detail (Tasks 5.1.2-5.1.5)
sources_used: Smart Grids Co-Simulations survey methodology examples
